page.title: 12Education
page.content: Children from this area attend one of four primary schools, tranfering to a comprehensive school at eleven. Children from the Wolverham area attend Stanney Comprehensive School, and children from the Westminster area attend Grange Comprehensive School. However, this is certain to change in the near future. Grange Comprehensive will admit pupils for the last time in September 1985. Catchment areas for the other comprehensive schools will then be re_drawn. This is in line with the policy of the Cheshire County Council, and reflects the fall in the birth rate in the town over the last 10 years. Pupils from the Weatminster area will have a longer daily journey to school in future years.
